original_title: Sri Lanka in talks with Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation for automation in agriculture
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka plans to digitalise and modernise the agriculture sector and is in talks with the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, President Ranil Wickremesinghe said.

Plans to digitalise the agriculture sector will be made through data-based decision-making in the agricultural sector to modernize, nutrition, combating climate change and developing financial security.

Officials of the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation have assured President Wickremesinghe interventions would be made under government policies and regulations in financial aid and modern technology, a statement from the Department of Government Information said.

Sri Lanka may be looking at automation and robotics as potential solutions to labor shortages brought on by the country’s aging population amid a sharp rise in migration of skilled and unskilled labor, according to a remark by President Ranil Wickremesinghe in November.

Although Sri Lanka strives to leap into automation and robotics several industries claim that the country is not cash ready and culturally ready to accept the technological challenges posed. (Colombo/May31/2023)
